Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.content:

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: Targeting TBK1 to overcome resistance to cancer immunotherapy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Targeting TBK1 to overcome resistance to cancer immunotherapy

  • Yi Sun
  • Or-yam Revach
  • Russell W. Jenkins
Article 12 Jan 2023

entry.title: Spike and nsp6 are key determinants of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.1 attenuation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Spike and nsp6 are key determinants of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.1 attenuation

  • Da-Yuan Chen
  • Chue Vin Chin
  • Mohsan Saeed
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Financial incentives for vaccination do not have negative unintended consequences (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Financial incentives for vaccination do not have negative unintended consequences

Findings from large-scale studies in Sweden and the USA indicate that providing financial incentives for vaccination and informing about state incentive programmes do not have any negative unintended consequences.

  • Florian H. Schneider
  • Pol Campos-Mercade
  • Armando N. Meier
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Grain shape effects in bed load sediment transport (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Grain shape effects in bed load sediment transport

Theoretical and experimental analysis of the effect of grain shape in bed load sediment transport is performed and a shape-corrected sediment transport law that provides greater accuracy in predictions is proposed.

  • Eric Deal
  • Jeremy G. Venditti
  • J. Taylor Perron
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: A ligand insertion mechanism for cooperative NH3 capture in metal–organic frameworks (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A ligand insertion mechanism for cooperative NH3 capture in metal–organic frameworks

A three-dimensional metal–organic framework reversibly binds ammonia by cooperative insertion into its metal–linker bonds to form a dense, one-dimensional coordination polymer, enabling high-capacity ammonia uptake with intrinsic thermal management.

  • Benjamin E. R. Snyder
  • Ari B. Turkiewicz
  • Jeffrey R. Long
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: γδ T cells are effectors of immunotherapy in cancers with HLA class I defects (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
γδ T cells are effectors of immunotherapy in cancers with HLA class I defects

γδ T cells contribute to the response to immune checkpoint blockade treatment in patients with HLA-class-I-negative DNA mismatch repair-deficient colon cancers. .

  • Natasja L. de Vries
  • Joris van de Haar
  • Emile E. Voest
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Seasonal temperatures in West Antarctica during the Holocene (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Seasonal temperatures in West Antarctica during the Holocene

Analysis of a continuous record of water-isotope ratios from the West Antarctic Ice Sheet Divide ice core reveals a dominant role for annual maximum insolation in determining West Antarctic summer temperature during the Holocene.

  • Tyler R. Jones
  • Kurt M. Cuffey
  • James W. C. White
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Long-range ordered porous carbons produced from C60 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Long-range ordered porous carbons produced from C60

A new type of carbon, long-range ordered porous carbon, is synthesized from carbon fullerenes at the gram scale and under ambient pressure.

  • Fei Pan
  • Kun Ni
  • Yanwu Zhu
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Short tRNA anticodon stem and mutant eRF1 allow stop codon reassignment (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Short tRNA anticodon stem and mutant eRF1 allow stop codon reassignment

Analyses of in-frame stop codons in protein-coding genes of Blastocrithidia nonstop with all three stop codons reassigned reveal a mechanism for UGA reassignment in eukaryotes involving shortening of the tRNA anticodon stem and a mutant eRF1 release factor.

  • Ambar Kachale
  • Zuzana Pavlíková
  • Julius Lukeš
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: An electric molecular motor (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An electric molecular motor

An electrically driven motor on the molecular scale based on [3]catenane is described, in which two cyclobis(paraquat-p-phenylene) rings operate by means of redox reactions, demonstrating highly unidirectional movement around a circular loop.

  • Long Zhang
  • Yunyan Qiu
  • J. Fraser Stoddart
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: STEREO neutrino spectrum of 235U fission rejects sterile neutrino hypothesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
STEREO neutrino spectrum of 235U fission rejects sterile neutrino hypothesis

Accurate measurements of the antineutrino energy spectrum of 235U fission by the STEREO detector reject the sterile neutrino hypothesis and point to biases in the nuclear data to explain the discrepancies with the prediction.

  • H. Almazán
  • L. Bernard
  • M. Vialat
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Unitary p-wave interactions between fermions in an optical lattice (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Unitary p-wave interactions between fermions in an optical lattice

The authors measure elastic p-wave interaction energies in pairs of fermionic atoms occupying the lowest two orbitals of an optical lattice; isolation of individual pairs of atoms protects against three-body recombination, enabling a theoretical maximum of interaction energy to be achieved.

  • Vijin Venu
  • Peihang Xu
  • Joseph H. Thywissen
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: An atlas of substrate specificities for the human serine/threonine kinome (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An atlas of substrate specificities for the human serine/threonine kinome

Analysis of the kinase activity of 300 protein Ser/Thr kinases reveals that the substrate specificity of the kinome is substantially more diverse than expected and is driven extensively by negative selectivity

  • Jared L. Johnson
  • Tomer M. Yaron
  • Lewis C. Cantley
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Approaching the quantum limit in two-dimensional semiconductor contacts (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Approaching the quantum limit in two-dimensional semiconductor contacts

The electrical contact of two-dimensional transistors is pushed close to the quantum limit by hybridization of the energy bands with antimony; the contacts have low contact resistance and excellent stability.

  • Weisheng Li
  • Xiaoshu Gong
  • Xinran Wang
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Periclase deforms more slowly than bridgmanite under mantle conditions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Periclase deforms more slowly than bridgmanite under mantle conditions

The authors model the creep of MgO periclase at lower mantle pressures and temperatures, finding that it deforms more slowly than bridgmanite at mantle strain rate.

  • Patrick Cordier
  • Karine Gouriet
  • Philippe Carrez
Article Open Access 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Enhanced superconductivity in spin–orbit proximitized bilayer graphene (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Enhanced superconductivity in spin–orbit proximitized bilayer graphene

Placing monolayer tungsten diselenide on Bernal-stacked bilayer graphene promotes enhanced superconductivity, indicating that proximity-induced spin–orbit coupling plays a key role in stabilizing the pairing, paving the way for engineering tunable, ultra-clean graphene-based superconductors.

  • Yiran Zhang
  • Robert Polski
  • Stevan Nadj-Perge
Article 11 Jan 2023

entry.title: Structural basis for intrinsic transcription termination (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structural basis for intrinsic transcription termination

Structural studies of Escherichia coli transcription intrinsic termination complexes representing distinct intermediates using cryo-electron microscopy provide insights into the steps and mechanism of transcription termination.

  • Linlin You
  • Expery O. Omollo
  • Yu Zhang
Article 11 Jan 2023
